Docs.summary: Contains types that enable support for authentication. is the main entry point which defines the 5 authentication actions: Authenticate (get any authentication data for a request), Challenge (used for unauthenticated requests), Forbid (used when an authenticated request should be denied), SignIn (associate a ClaimsPrincipal), SignOut (remove any associated data). At a high level, authentication is based around the concept of schemes, which are mapped to specific instances which are responsible for handling each of the authentication actions.
Docs.remarks: For more information about authentication, see Introduction to authentication in ASP.NET Core.
